availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Murrell Shackelford (Lincoln/ Hopkins County, KY, attorney, colonel 25th Inf, 8th Ky Cav, and brig gen. in 1863)

body.p: Hopkins County and Lincoln County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Marion Ross Shackelford in Union County, Kentucky, in November 1850. Father of Emma Shackelford, Addison Shackelford, Ross Shackelford, and Nora Shackelford. Attorney in Hopkins County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment as a second lieutenant and first lieutenant in the U.S.-Mexico War. Attorney in Louisville from c1848 to 1861. Served in the 25th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel from January 1, 1862, to March 24, 1862. Served in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel from September 13, 1862. Appointed brigadier general of volunteers on January 2, 1863. Commanded forces that captured General John Hunt Morgan at Salineville, Ohio, on July 26, 1863. Resigned his commission on January 18, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 813.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Union County Marriages, Film #000562200.
Spencer C. Tucker, "James Murrell Shackelford" in American Civil War: The Definitive Encyclopedia and Document Collection, eds. Spencer C. Tucker, James Arnold, Roberta Weiner, and Paul G. Pierpaoli, Jr. (Oxford: ABC-CLIO: 2013), 1749-50.
